title: QPR 'disgusted, embarrassed and dismayed' by Uefa's apparent lack of action over alleged racism in U18s game
text:
Queens Park Rangers have said they are “disgusted, embarrassed and dismayed” over the way football’s governing bodies Uefa and Fifa have handled an allegation of racism that led to the club abandoning an Under-18s game.

Lee Hoos, the QPR chief executive, has reacted angrily at the lack of action almost three months after the incident in a pre-season friendly in Spain between QPR and AD Nervion during which coach Paul Furlong told his side to leave the pitch after apparently suffering racial abuse.

Hoos has released a statement the day after Uefa’s disciplinary process came under fierce criticism with the decision to fine Bulgaria just €75,000 (£65,000) and play only one game behind closed doors after the horrific racial abuse of England players during the recent Euro 2020 qualifier.

The game in Sofia was stopped twice and came close to being abandoned as the England players followed the Uefa protocols after being targeted. It led to calls for Bulgaria to be kicked out of the competition and for players to walk off in similar circumstances.

The QPR players did just that after claiming a number were subjected to racist abuse during the second-half of their friendly in Seville. After one player informed Furlong he decided to take his team off.
